vision: A lightweight, dual-platform notepad with automatic syntax highlighting that runs seamlessly in both browser and desktop.

target_audience.primary: Developers and programmers who need a lightweight, cross-platform code editor with automatic syntax highlighting for quick file editing
secondary: Technical writers editing markdown and documentation files
Students learning to code who want a simple editor
Power users who want a fast notepad alternative with syntax highlighting

phases.name: Foundation & Quality
phases.description: Establish robust foundation with comprehensive testing, error handling, and production-ready builds. Ensure the core experience is rock-solid before adding features.

milestones.title: Test Infrastructure Complete
milestones.description: Unit tests and E2E tests running for both browser and Electron platforms

milestones.title: Production Ready
milestones.description: Electron app packaged and distributable, browser version deployable

phases.name: Core Experience Enhancement
phases.description: Add essential features that developers expect from a code editor while maintaining the lightweight, fast experience.

milestones.title: Developer-Friendly Editing
milestones.description: Line numbers, find/replace, and keyboard shortcuts match developer expectations

milestones.title: Personalized Experience
milestones.description: Theme support and recent files make the editor feel personal and efficient

phases.name: Power User Features
phases.description: Add advanced features for power users who want more from their quick-edit tool, while keeping the lightweight core.

milestones.title: Multi-File Workflow
milestones.description: Users can work with multiple files efficiently via tabs and session restoration

milestones.title: Smart Editing
milestones.description: Auto-save, code folding, and large file support for professional workflows

phases.name: Growth & Polish
phases.description: Polish the experience and add features that help grow the user base through word-of-mouth and differentiation.

milestones.title: Customization Complete
milestones.description: Settings UI and keyboard customization available

milestones.title: Market Ready
milestones.description: App store presence and community features for growth

features.title: Unit Test Infrastructure
features.description: Set up comprehensive unit testing infrastructure with Vitest for both shared code and platform-specific adapters. Cover file system abstraction, syntax highlighting, and language detection logic.
features.rationale: Without tests, refactoring and adding features becomes risky. Tests are foundation for sustainable development and catch regressions early. Addresses technical debt from discovery.
acceptance_criteria: Vitest configured and running for browser and Electron code
File system abstraction has 80%+ test coverage
Syntax highlighting logic has unit tests for all 17 supported languages
Test commands added to package.json (npm test, npm run test:watch)
Tests run in under 30 seconds
user_stories: As a developer, I want automated tests so that I can refactor with confidence
As a contributor, I want clear test patterns so that I can add tests for new features

features.title: End-to-End Testing
features.description: Implement E2E tests using Playwright for browser and Spectron/Playwright for Electron. Test critical user flows: open file, edit, save, syntax highlighting display.
features.rationale: E2E tests verify the complete user experience works across platforms. Critical for a dual-platform app where platform-specific bugs are common.
acceptance_criteria: Playwright configured for browser testing
Electron E2E testing framework set up
Core flows tested: open file, edit content, save file
Syntax highlighting verification in tests
Tests run in CI pipeline
user_stories: As a developer, I want E2E tests so that releases don't break user workflows
As a user, I want a reliable app that works consistently on both platforms

features.title: Error Boundary & Graceful Degradation
features.description: Add error boundaries to catch syntax highlighting failures, file operation errors, and other runtime issues. Display user-friendly error messages and allow graceful recovery.
features.rationale: Users should never see a blank screen or crash. Graceful error handling builds trust and ensures the app remains usable even when things go wrong.
acceptance_criteria: Syntax highlighting failures fall back to plain text display
File open errors show clear user-friendly message
File save errors prompt user to try again or save elsewhere
App never shows blank screen on errors
Error details logged for debugging
user_stories: As a user, I want clear error messages so that I understand what went wrong
As a user, I want the app to recover from errors so that I don't lose my work

features.title: Electron Production Build & Distribution
features.description: Configure electron-builder for production builds on Windows, macOS, and Linux. Create installers (DMG, EXE, AppImage) and set up code signing.
features.rationale: Users need installable packages to use the desktop version. Professional installers build trust and make installation seamless. Addresses technical debt.
acceptance_criteria: electron-builder configured for all three platforms
DMG created for macOS with proper app icon
EXE installer created for Windows
AppImage created for Linux
Build process documented in README
App version displayed in UI
user_stories: As a macOS user, I want a DMG so that I can drag-and-drop install the app
As a Windows user, I want an installer so that the app integrates with my system

features.title: CI/CD Pipeline
features.description: Set up GitHub Actions for continuous integration: run tests on push, build binaries on release, and deploy browser version. Automate quality gates.
features.rationale: Automation ensures every change is tested and releases are consistent. Reduces manual error and speeds up development cycle.
acceptance_criteria: GitHub Actions workflow for running tests on PR
Build workflow creates binaries for all platforms
Browser version auto-deploys to GitHub Pages on main branch merge
Release workflow creates GitHub release with binaries
Build status badge in README
user_stories: As a developer, I want automated builds so that releases are consistent
As a contributor, I want CI checks so that I know if my PR breaks anything

features.title: Line Numbers Display
features.description: Add optional line numbers in the editor gutter. Line numbers should be visible in both edit mode and preview mode, synced with scroll position.
features.rationale: Developers universally expect line numbers in code editors. This is a fundamental feature that built-in editors lack. Addresses competitor pain point from built-in OS editors.
acceptance_criteria: Line numbers displayed in left gutter
Line numbers scroll with content
Current line highlighted
Toggle to show/hide line numbers
Line numbers work in both edit and preview modes
user_stories: As a developer, I want line numbers so that I can reference specific lines
As a user, I want to see which line I'm editing for orientation in long files

features.title: Find and Replace
features.description: Implement find and replace functionality with regex support, case sensitivity toggle, and whole word matching. Include find next/previous navigation.
features.rationale: Find and replace is essential for editing code files. All competitor editors have this feature. Major gap compared to built-in editors.
acceptance_criteria: Find dialog opens with Ctrl+F / Cmd+F
Replace dialog opens with Ctrl+H / Cmd+H
Case sensitive search toggle
Whole word matching toggle
Regex search toggle
Match count displayed
Navigate between matches with Enter or arrows
Replace and Replace All functionality
user_stories: As a developer, I want to find text quickly so that I can navigate large files
As a user, I want to replace text efficiently so that I can make bulk changes

features.title: Enhanced Keyboard Shortcuts
features.description: Implement comprehensive keyboard shortcuts matching developer expectations: duplicate line, move line up/down, toggle comment, indent/outdent, go to line.
features.rationale: Power users rely on keyboard shortcuts for efficient editing. Missing shortcuts frustrate developers coming from other editors.
acceptance_criteria: Ctrl+D / Cmd+D duplicates current line
Alt+Up/Down moves line up/down
Ctrl+/ / Cmd+/ toggles line comment
Tab/Shift+Tab for indent/outdent
Ctrl+G / Cmd+G for go to line dialog
Shortcuts displayed in menu or help panel
Shortcuts work consistently on all platforms
user_stories: As a developer, I want familiar shortcuts so that I can edit quickly
As a power user, I want line manipulation shortcuts so that I can work efficiently

features.title: Dark Mode & Theme Support
features.description: Add dark mode with system preference detection. Include 2-3 built-in themes (light, dark, high contrast) and ensure syntax highlighting colors adapt to theme.
features.rationale: Dark mode is expected by developers and reduces eye strain. Many competitors have dated light-only UIs. Differentiates from Notepad++ dated appearance.
acceptance_criteria: Dark mode with dark background and light text
Light mode with light background and dark text
High contrast mode for accessibility
Automatic detection of system color scheme preference
Syntax highlighting colors adapt to each theme
Theme preference persisted in localStorage
Toggle in UI to switch themes
user_stories: As a developer, I want dark mode so that I can reduce eye strain at night
As a user, I want the app to match my system theme automatically

features.title: Recent Files List
features.description: Track recently opened files and display them in a quick-access list. Allow users to reopen recent files with one click. Persist across sessions.
features.rationale: Reduces friction for repeated editing of same files. Identified as known gap in discovery. Saves time compared to navigating file dialogs repeatedly.
acceptance_criteria: Recent files list shows last 10 opened files
List persisted in localStorage (browser) and electron-store (desktop)
One-click to reopen file
Clear option to remove individual items or all
Shows file name and path
Handles missing files gracefully (removes from list)
user_stories: As a user, I want to quickly reopen files I was working on yesterday
As a developer, I want quick access to config files I edit frequently

features.title: Font Customization
features.description: Allow users to customize editor font family, size, and line height. Include popular monospace font options and custom font input.
features.rationale: Font preferences are personal and affect readability. Developers have strong font preferences (Fira Code, JetBrains Mono, etc.).
acceptance_criteria: Font size adjustable (8px - 32px)
Preset monospace fonts (system, Consolas, Monaco, Fira Code)
Custom font family input
Line height adjustable
Changes preview in real-time
Preferences persisted
user_stories: As a developer, I want to use my preferred coding font
As a user with vision issues, I want to increase font size for readability

features.title: Multi-Tab Interface
features.description: Support opening multiple files in tabs. Allow tab reordering, close individual tabs, and close-all functionality. Show unsaved indicator per tab.
features.rationale: Multiple tabs are standard in code editors. While this adds complexity, power users expect to work with multiple files without reopening.
acceptance_criteria: Multiple files open simultaneously in tabs
Tab bar shows file names
Unsaved indicator (dot/asterisk) on modified tabs
Click tab to switch files
Right-click context menu: close, close others, close all
Drag to reorder tabs
Ctrl+W / Cmd+W closes current tab
Ctrl+Tab cycles through tabs
user_stories: As a developer, I want to open multiple files so that I can reference one while editing another
As a user, I want tabs so that I don't lose context when switching files

features.title: Auto-Save
features.description: Optionally auto-save files after a configurable delay. Include visual indicator when auto-save is pending or complete. Option to disable per-file or globally.
features.rationale: Auto-save prevents data loss and matches modern app expectations. Reduces friction of manual saving.
acceptance_criteria: Auto-save toggle in settings (off by default)
Configurable delay (1-30 seconds)
Visual indicator when file is being saved
No auto-save for new untitled files
Works in both browser and Electron
Respects file system permissions
user_stories: As a user, I want auto-save so that I don't lose work if I forget to save
As a developer, I want configurable auto-save delay to control when saves happen

features.title: Session Restoration
features.description: Remember open files and cursor positions when closing the app. Offer to restore session on next launch. Works with multi-tab feature.
features.rationale: Addresses known gap of no session history. Users expect to continue where they left off, especially after accidental closes.
acceptance_criteria: Open files list saved on close
Cursor position per file saved
Scroll position per file saved
Prompt to restore session on launch
Option to always restore without prompt
Handles missing files gracefully
user_stories: As a user, I want to continue where I left off after closing the app
As a developer, I want my workspace restored after a restart

features.title: Code Folding
features.description: Add ability to fold/collapse code blocks (functions, classes, objects). Show fold indicators in gutter. Support fold all/unfold all.
features.rationale: Code folding helps navigate large files by hiding irrelevant sections. Expected feature for code editors handling large files.
acceptance_criteria: Fold indicators in gutter for foldable blocks
Click to fold/unfold individual blocks
Keyboard shortcut to fold/unfold (Ctrl+Shift+[ and ])
Fold all / Unfold all command
Folded blocks show ellipsis (...)
Works with major languages (JS, Python, JSON, HTML)
user_stories: As a developer, I want to fold functions so that I can focus on relevant code
As a user editing large JSON, I want to collapse sections for navigation

features.title: Large File Performance Optimization
features.description: Optimize handling of files larger than 1MB. Implement virtualized rendering for long files and optional syntax highlighting disable for very large files.
features.rationale: Addresses known gap of large file handling. Prevents app from becoming unresponsive with large log files or data files.
acceptance_criteria: Files up to 5MB open within 2 seconds
Syntax highlighting optional for files > 1MB
Virtual scrolling for files > 10000 lines
Memory usage stays under 200MB for large files
Warning message for files > 10MB
No blocking or freezing during large file operations
user_stories: As a sysadmin, I want to view large log files without the app freezing
As a developer, I want to open large JSON files quickly

features.title: Settings UI Panel
features.description: Create a visual settings panel to configure all preferences. Replace manual config with user-friendly toggles, dropdowns, and inputs.
features.rationale: Visual settings are more approachable than JSON config files (Sublime Text weakness). Makes customization accessible to all users.
acceptance_criteria: Settings panel opens from menu or Ctrl+, / Cmd+,
Sections for Editor, Appearance, Files
Changes apply immediately
Reset to defaults option
Settings sync between browser and desktop (optional)
user_stories: As a user, I want a visual settings panel instead of editing config files
As a new user, I want to discover available settings easily

features.title: Customizable Keyboard Shortcuts
features.description: Allow users to customize keyboard shortcuts. Show current bindings and allow rebinding. Support importing/exporting keybindings.
features.rationale: Power users have muscle memory from other editors. Allowing customization reduces friction for users switching from other tools.
acceptance_criteria: List of all commands with current shortcuts
Click to record new shortcut
Conflict detection and warning
Reset individual or all shortcuts
Export keybindings as JSON
Import keybindings from JSON
user_stories: As a Sublime Text user, I want to use my familiar shortcuts
As a power user, I want to optimize shortcuts for my workflow

features.title: Additional Language Support
features.description: Expand syntax highlighting to support more languages beyond the initial 17. Add languages based on user requests and popularity.
features.rationale: More language support expands the user base. Some users need niche languages that aren't in initial set.
acceptance_criteria: Add 10+ additional languages (Rust, Go, Swift, Kotlin, etc.)
Language packs loaded on-demand to keep initial bundle small
User can request languages via GitHub issues
Language detection updated for new extensions
Documentation of supported languages
user_stories: As a Rust developer, I want Rust syntax highlighting
As a Go developer, I want Go files highlighted correctly

features.title: Drag and Drop File Opening
features.description: Allow users to drag files from file explorer directly onto the app window to open them. Support in both browser and Electron.
features.rationale: Drag and drop is a natural interaction that users expect. Reduces steps to open files compared to file dialog.
acceptance_criteria: Drag file onto window shows drop zone indicator
Dropping file opens it in editor
Works in browser version (reads file content)
Works in Electron version (gets file path)
Multiple files dropped open in tabs (if tabs enabled)
Non-text files show error message
user_stories: As a user, I want to drag files to open them quickly
As a power user, I want to drop multiple files to open them all
